pr_title: Add class for SAML provider config.

timeline.bodyText: These should be kept out of the public API.
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: I had tried this during development but was getting a strange error. However, making this package private seems to work now (it must have been failing for another reason which I have since fixed).
replies.author: micahstairs

replies.bodyText:
So I guess we still were getting these errors (I was just running the tests in the wrong directory).
I've resolved the visibility problem by moving these subtypes into SamlProviderConfigResponse.
replies.author: micahstairs

timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.bodyText: Given these are only used in SamlProviderConfig, how about pushing them down to the child class?
timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.bodyText: I think ensureNestedMap() and ensureNestedList() indicate the intent of these a bit better.
timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Move closer to the other idpConfig related methods
timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.bodyText: We should also probably have an addAllX505Certificates(List<String>) API here.
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: I assume you mean addAllX509Certificates? And yes, I already have a TODO to add that. I wanted to keep this PR to the bare essentials required.
replies.author: micahstairs

timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: Done. I also made the same change in OidcProviderConfigTest and TenantTest.
replies.author: micahstairs

timeline.bodyText: I think we are missing some imports here causing a compilation error.
timeline.author: hiranya911
hiranya911

timeline.message: Add class for SAML provider config.
Move SAML nested types to internal package.

timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: The GenericJson approach ended up working well! I thought it was going to be more complicated than it was, since we have nested types.
replies.author: micahstairs

timeline.message: Use GenericJson instead of new internal types.
